"Digital disruption is happening in the food industry. It's moving forward, but it's facing an intersect of challenges. We have a lot of work to do. We need to create solutions at every step of the supply chain." -- Julie Vargas

"We actually make enough food right now to feed the world 1.5 times. We're just not able to distribute¬†the food to those who need it. At Avery Dennison, we're examining this issue across all steps of the supply chain." -- Julie Vargas
"Currently there's no obvious tie between the amount of food harvested and the amount of food consumers need. There are many opportunities for data to drive more efficiency." -- Julie Vargas
Avery Dennison announces Third Quarter 2019 results. https://t.co/GCxw1kewYw https://t.co/75FF9665ar
"By integrating #RFID technology, you're able to take action on instant and automated data. In the case of a recall, for example, you're able to eliminate only the food impacted." --Julie Vargas

"Currently, 1/3 of the world's food is wasted before it can be consumed. At Avery Dennison, we know the humble label can play a critical role in preventing this loss." -- Julie Vargas, Director of Global RFID Market Development
